output: 1. Take the original 5x5 matrix and add it to itself transposed, creating a 5x10 matrix.2. Append a reversed list of the column at index 3 to the end of the new matrix.3. In a similar manner, continue appending reversed versions of the next columns from the original 5x5 matrix to the bottom of the new matrix, working outwards from the center column.4. Eventually, this will result in a 10x10 matrix where the extra rows are mirrored versions of the original columns.

top row from left to right, right column from top to bottom, bottom row from right to left, left column from bottom to top. The remaining integers will be the center integer(s) of the input array.2. Append the margin to the right of the input array. If the input array is N by N, append the margin to the nth row (0-indexed) of the input data.3. Prepend the margin in reverse order to the left of the input array. Prepend the reverse of the margin to the nth row (0-indexed) of the input data.4. Finally, transform the entire array into a 1D list and that is the output.
